items.title: fix bug dcatap prefix in shacl.ttl files
items.body:
Bug in shacl files. 

- **Wrong:** `@prefix dcatap: <http://data.europa.eu/r5r>` evaluates `dcatap:availability` as `http://data.europa.eu/r5ravailability` 

- **Right:** `@prefix dcatap: <http://data.europa.eu/r5r/>` evaluates `dcatap:availability` as   `http://data.europa.eu/r5r/availability`

items.title: Retrieving data via data.europa.eu/sparql
items.body:
## I expect

to retrieve vocabularies from the data.europa.eu/sparql endpoint

## Because

I want to integrate and validate information and vocabularies with the ones provided by this repo

## Reproduce

The following query returns an empty result.

```
select distinct * where {
<http://data.europa.eu/m8g/Criterion> ?p ?q
} LIMIT 100
```

items.title: 4.16 clean metadata if it is no longer inspire (#15047)
items.body:
If user unchecks Initiativ=Inspire then we should clear some inspire-specific elements like Gemet Spatial Themes and Conformance reports citing to Implementing rules.
If no `descriptiveKeyword` Inspire in Initiativ thesaurus:
* Remove GEMET thesaurus.
* Remove conformance report with `xlink:href="http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg/2010/1089"` or
`xlink:href="http://data.europa.eu/eli/reg/2009/976"`

items.title: Map EIC fields to dcat or skos

milestone.title: Release 1
milestone.description: 2022-08-19 - Scope of first release must be agreed and sent out to CIM EG 2 week review

items.body:
Currently CIM flields are there

Some initial mapping:
eic:EICCode_MarketDocument.mRID -> dcterms:identifer
eic:EICCode_MarketDocument.long_Names.name -> skos:altLabel
eic:EICCode_MarketDocument.display_Names.name -> skos:prefLabel
eic:EICCode_MarketDocument.lastRequest_DateAndOrTime.date -> at:start.use

But all fields form XSD should be mapped or then excluded

items.body: The Namespace for StatDCAT-AP is provided and maintained by https://data.europa.eu/URI is. Provisional one (http://data.europa.eu/(xyz)/statdcat-ap/) should be replaced by: <http://data.europa.eu/s1n>

items.title: Include ISIMIP extreme heat, Deltares coastal flooding, JRC fluvial flooding
items.body:
Additional return-period maps for flooding and extreme heat.

Links for ISIMIP and Deltares data:

[GRII_open_hazard_links.csv](https://github.com/nismod/open-gira/files/9488963/GRII_open_hazard_links.csv)

### Deltares Global Flood Maps (coastal flooding)

Linked from https://planetarycomputer.microsoft.com/dataset/deltares-floods

### ISIMIP2b Output Data for Lange et al. (2020)

Linked from https://data.isimip.org/search/tree/ISIMIP2b/DerivedOutputData/lange2020/hwmid-humidex/

> Stefan Lange, Jan Volkholz, Tobias Geiger, Fang Zhao, Iliusi Vega del Valle, Ted Veldkamp, Christopher Reyer, Lila Warszawski, Veronika Huber, Jonas Jägermeyr, Jacob Schewe, David N. Bresch, Matthias Büchner, Jinfeng Chang, Philippe Ciais, Marie Dury, Kerry Emanuel, Christian Folberth, Dieter Gerten, Simon N. Gosling, Manolis Grillakis, Naota Hanasaki, Alexandra‐Jane Henrot, Thomas Hickler, Yasushi Honda, Akihiko Ito, Nikolay Khabarov, Aristeidis Koutroulis, Wenfeng Liu, Christoph Müller, Kazuya Nishina, Sebastian Ostberg, Hannes Müller Schmied, Sonia I. Seneviratne, Tobias Stacke, Jörg Steinkamp, Wim Thiery, Yoshihide Wada, Sven Willner, Hong Yang, Minoru Yoshikawa, Chao Yue, Katja Frieler (2020): Land area fractions and population fractions exposed to extreme climate impact events derived from ISIMIP2b output data (v1.0). ISIMIP Repository. https://doi.org/10.48364/ISIMIP.924045 

### JRC Global River Flooding

[jrc-global.csv](https://github.com/nismod/open-gira/files/9488997/jrc-global.csv)

Linked from https://data.jrc.ec.europa.eu/collection/id-0054

> Dottori, Francesco; Alfieri, Lorenzo; Salamon, Peter; Bianchi, Alessandra; Feyen, Luc; Hirpa, Feyera (2016): Flood hazard map of the World - 10-year return period. European Commission, Joint Research Centre (JRC) [Dataset] PID: http://data.europa.eu/89h/jrc-floods-floodmapgl_rp10y-tif
(similar citation suggested per return period)

items.title: Part B - Remapping of Extended Capabilities - About conformity issue
items.body:
This issue is aimed at summarizing the proposals about the mapping of the `<inspire_common:Conformity>` element starting from the [Annex B in the consolidated proposal](https://github.com/INSPIRE-MIF/gp-data-service-linking-simplification/blob/main/proposals/JRC/ds-linking-simplification-good-practice.md#annex-b-mapping-of-inspire-elements-in-the-extended-capabilities-section-), in order to add further specific comments and to reach a consensus by the sub-group.

As pointed out in the Implementation Requirement 22 in [INSPIRE NS - View Service TG](https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/documents/technical-guidance-implementation-inspire-view-services-1), the INSPIRE Metadata Regulation requires that metadata shall include information on the degree of conformity with the implementing rules on interoperability of services. For this purpose, the `<inspire_common:Conformity>` element shall be added within an `<inspire_vs:ExtendedCapabilities>` (see Implementation Requirement 23 in [INSPIRE NS - View Service TG](https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/documents/technical-guidance-implementation-inspire-view-services-1))  or an `<inspire_dls:ExtendedCapabilities>` (see TG Requirement 53 in  [INSPIRE NS - Download Service TG](https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/documents/technical-guidance-implementation-inspire-download-services)) element. 
As the common opinion in the sub-group is that the extended capabilities should be removed, we need to find an element in the service metadata to use instead of the `<inspire_common:Conformity>` element, keeping the conformance to metadata Regulation.

### [Proposal from IT](#13) (me)
Having as reference the Regulation 1089/2010 (against which it is mandatory to declare the conformance based on Metadata TG),  the proposal is adding a specific keyword encoded with the values coming from the [code list "Degree of conformity"](https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/DegreeOfConformity) published in the INSPIRE metadata code list register.
With respect to other specifications (e.g. Regulation 976/2009), each service provider is free to add an extended capabilities section (that is kept as optional) including the `<inspire_common:Conformity>` element.
Here the examples about this proposal:

- For WMS, add a `wms:Keyword` element with a value coming from the code list mentioned above and the attribute `vocabulary` pointing to the code list URI within the `wms:KeyworList` group

```xml
...
<wms:KeywordList>
   <wms:Keyword vocabulary=”https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/DegreeOfConformity”>conformant</wms:Keyword>
...
</wms:KeywordList>
```

- For WFS, add a specific group `ows:Keywords` with a `ows:Keyword` element with a value coming from the code list mentioned above and a `ows:Type` element including the code list label and the attribute `codeSpace` pointing to the code list URI:

```xml
...
<ows:Keywords>
   <ows:Keyword>conformant</ows:Keyword>
   <ows:Type codeSpace="http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/DegreeOfConformity">Degree of conformity</ows:Type>
</ows:Keywords>
...
```

- For Atom, add a `atom:category` element including the `term` attribute with a value coming from the code list mentioned above and the `scheme` attribute pointing to the code list URI:

```xml
...
<atom:category term="conformant" scheme="https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/DegreeOfConformity"/>
...
```

### Proposals from FR (@MarieLambois)

- adding a specific keyword encoded with the values coming from the [Spatial data service type code list](https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/SpatialDataServiceType) to declare the conformity (see the specific [comment in the issue 12](https://github.com/INSPIRE-MIF/gp-data-service-linking-simplification/issues/12#issuecomment-881270930).
Example:

```xml
...
   <wms:Keyword vocabulary="http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/SpatialDataServiceType">view</wms:Keyword>
...
```
- Alternatively, adding a specific keyword to cite the Regulation applied for the conformity declaration (see the specific [comment in the issue 13](https://github.com/INSPIRE-MIF/gp-data-service-linking-simplification/issues/13#issuecomment-941073992)).
Example:


```xml
...
<wms:KeywordList>
   <wms:Keyword vocabulary=”https://inspire.ec.europa.eu/metadata-codelist/LevelOfConformity”>COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 976/2009</wms:Keyword>
...
</wms:KeywordList>
```

items.title: CPSV-AP / CPOV consistency: AdministrativeTerritorialUnit class
items.body: As reported in https://github.com/catalogue-of-services-isa/CPSV-AP/issues/83, the range of dct:spatial should be a controlled vocabulary as the definition of AdministrativeTerritorialUnit refers to a 'code from list...'  and the [URI of AdministrativeTerritorialUnit](https://data.europa.eu/data/datasets/atu-type?locale=en) points to a web page of data.europa.eu, which refers to a [controlled vocabulary from the Publication Office](https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/dataset/-/resource?uri=http://publications.europa.eu/resource/dataset/atu-type).

items.title: http://data.europa.eu/m8g/Participation bestaat niet
items.body:
**Subsidieregister** 

**Binnen het vocabularium https://data.vlaanderen.be/ns/subsidie wordt  http://data.europa.eu/m8g/Participation gebruikt.

Deze klasse bestaat niet.

Er wordt binnen de Core Public Service Vocabulary (AP) (<http://data.europa.eu/m8g/cpsvap> rdf:type owl:Ontology) verwezen naar http://data.europa.eu/m8g/Participation als rdfs:isDefinedBy <http://data.europa.eu/m8g/cpov>, het Core Public Organisation Vocabulary. De klasse wordt dus niet gedefiniëerd binnen cpsvap.

Het statement dat deze klasse binnen http://data.europa.eu/m8g/cpov is gedefinieerd klopt niet.
maw. We gebruiken dingen waarvan we de aard niet kennen.

https://github.com/SEMICeu/CPOV/blob/master/releases/1.00/Core%20Public%20Organisation%20Vocabulary_v1.0.0.ttl
en
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/e-government-core-vocabularies/core-public-organisation-vocabulary
** 

**Ik zou eens kijken binnen de qualified terms van provenance of er daar niets passend tussen zit. https://www.w3.org/TR/prov-o/#description-qualified-terms**

items.title: Handling versioned api
items.body:
[This line][1] suggests that `ckanapi` doesn't support APIs with different versions, for example http://data.europa.eu/euodp/data/api/3 .

Does `RemoteCKAN` need a new parameter in the constructor to specify the API version?

[1]: https://github.com/ckan/ckanapi/blob/3be4a5cfca992dcdedea72cf5afdf7f5ea5b078b/ckanapi/common.py#L90

items.title: Align metadata to DCAT/DCAT-AP
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Align to DCAT metadata to describe datasets

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Reuse terms and structure from DCAT in the metadata file, ideally generate a json-ld file dcat compliant

**Describe alternatives you've considered**


**Additional context**
DCAT is a W3C standard extended in Europe with DCAT-AP, an example is data.europa.eu publishing datasets metadata in DCAT-AP

items.title: [EU] Budget of the European Union for the year 2014
items.body:
Budget for the European Union for the year 2014 is available in XML (and simplified CSV) at http://open-data.europa.eu/data/dataset/budget-of-the-european-union-2014. The dataset contains a `metadata.xml` file with MFF/CATPOL code list that could be ETL'd separately.

Dataset structure should be similar to #16.

items.title: Participation resolvet niet
items.body:
**Model(len) waarop de issue van toepassing is:** 
[OSLO Besluit Subsidie](https://data.vlaanderen.be/doc/applicatieprofiel/besluit-subsidie/)

**Omschrijving van het probleem:** 
Agent#rol wordt in het schema op de participatie gedefinieerd en niet op de agent. Daarnaast is de keuze voor http://data.europa.eu/m8g/role te bekijken. URI resolvet niet en in andere OSLO AP werd gekozen voor http://www.w3.org/ns/org#role . Lijkt wel in lijn met CORE vocabularies. 

Zie ook [https://github.com/Informatievlaanderen/OSLO-Discussion/issues/318](https://github.com/Informatievlaanderen/OSLO-Discussion/issues/318)
